desc: STK19, a serine/threonine kinase, is mutated in a subset of skin cancers.

The STK19 gene encodes a serine/threonine protein kinase that predominantly localizes to the nucleus (PMID: 9812991). STK19 is located on chromosome 6, close to the major histocompatibility complex, a region frequently associated with several traits in case-control studies (PMID: 21323541, 23263863, 19851445, 23535732, 19423540). Besides STK19 catalytic activity and its ability to bind microtubular proteins, the exact function of this protein is unknown (PMID: 15986447). STK19 is mutated in a subset of skin cancers (PMID: 22817889, 25600636, 25303977).
